helpmascot: ^As you approach what seems to be a broken section of the highway guard rails, a blur of blue comes into view, sitting in the empty space.
^Eventually, you realize that the blur isn’t a something, but a someone, in a scuffed wolf-like fursuit. The furry stranger waves weakly towards the van.
^Ain’t no way… Gator, you have a lost brother?
^Gatorhead: Har har. Real funny. My brother ain’t a... uh... dog, though.
^Leslie: So close! Not a dog. Still, I’m curious now… let’s see what this guy wants.
^Upon a closer look, the wolf seems to be breathing heavily. Their suit is muddied in some places, and has lost color in others.
^You can make out only one word in between all their heaving: ‘water.’
^Leslie: Oh, their suit looks a bit… eugh.
^Gatorhead: That don’t matter. Didn’t they say they wanted water?
^Leslie: … Man, you can practically see their tongue lolling out.
^Gatorhead: Well, let’s give it to them!
^Leslie: I don’t know about this one, big guy… What if they have a disease? Plus, they need water alone to wash that suit… and that’s a lot of water.
^Gatorhead: Gimme the damn bottle, Les! Not letting my man turn into roadkill over here.
water: ^The 'wolf' turns away from your party, and you can hear them chugging the water. The sigh at the end was one of contentment. They turn around, fixing their headpiece.
^‘Wolf’: Thank you…………… Oh my god, that water was all I needed. Thank you, thank you. Oh, god.
^‘Wolf’: Er… sure? Anyways…. Here’s my thank you in turn.
^[ Item Received: Coupon, 20% off any beverages at the next available gas station ]
^‘Wolf’: Hope this helps. Tell Doug I say hello.
^Leslie: Ugh, you’re sounding dehydrated yourself. Let’s go.
nowater: ^You decide to floor it. Out of your rearview mirror, you can see the wolf-man slump forward, hands outstretched towards the van. And then, a pretty haunting,
^Leslie: Well, I stand by it. Besides, that ain’t even a good wolf howl!
^Gatorhead: Oh, fuck off, Les. Tear that stupid grin off your face.
